text: David Faber (August 25, 1928 - July 28, 2015) was a Polish writer and educator. He was Jewish and survived nine concentration camps in occupied Poland and Nazi Germany. He was also an award-winning educator and lecturer on the Holocaust. Faber died on July 28, 2015 in San Diego, California at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Polish educators Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Jewish American writers Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Polish Jews
